partnerName: The Soho London Independent Film Festival
partnerDescription: SohoLIFF is a ground-breaking film festival bringing together new and seasoned filmmakers in one space – a showcase and networking event where ideas can be shared, and advice proffered. Including drama, documentary, comedy, animation, experimental, horror, student and social impact categories… it is open to everyone.

movies.title: (K)nox: The Rob Knox Story
movies.description: A young actor is stabbed to death just days after filming his big break in the Harry Potter franchise.

movies.title: 3:35 to Boston
movies.description: A military wife, struggling to balance all the pieces of her life, breaks down when she realizes that the life she had planned for herself may not be possible.

movies.title: The Day I Became A British Citizen
movies.description: Brexit and the pandemic are just the latest hurdles for migrants around the world. This documentary explores the naturalization process for UK-based migrants in lockdown.

movies.title: 51 States
movies.description: In an all too possible future, a Sikh wife and mother risks execution in the fight to be reunited with her family

members.name: Liz Farahadi
members.title: Festival Director
members.description: Liz runs and oversees the development and the day to day operations of the Soho London Independent Film Festival, heading up each department. She is also a Director and founder of the festival

members.name: Stephen Kearney
members.title: Festival Director
members.description: Stephen is an actor, writer, musician and producer. In 2019 he starred in “Our Father” by Jacob Watkinson, which has been nominated in 5 festivals for acting and direction.

members.name: Julia Olsen
members.title: Festival Director
members.description: Julia is a screenplay writer and executive producer. She is a founder of the festival because of her expertise and experience in community engagement and the impact arts.

members.name: Charlotte Atkinson
members.title: Press & Media
members.description: Charlotte runs press and communications for SohoLIFF, joining the team in 2021
